DOC.brief_title: Assessement Hemodynamic Changes Associated With Uterine Displacement Using Noninvasive Cardiac Output Monitoring Transthoracic Echocardiography :
DOC.detailed_description: Aortocaval compression well-recognized physiologic concern pregnancy . The gravid uterus compress inferior vena cava , impede venous return thereby reduce stroke volume cardiac output . The 2014 Society Obstetric Anesthesia Perinatology consensus statement management cardiac arrest pregnancy , 2010 American Heart Association guideline maternal cardiac arrest recommend relieve aortocaval compression chest compression perform uterine displacement There currently little information regard hemodynamic difference amongst recommend uterine displacement technique . DOC.criteria: 1 . Healthy ASA physical status III 2 . Term parturient 1 . Woman labor 2 . Presence maternal medical condition affect cardiovascular system ( include preeclampsia , gestational hypertension ) 3 . Fetal anomaly intrauterine growth restriction ( < 25th percentile ) 4 . Maternal renal endocrine disease
